revision.text:
{{Infobox Sailboat Specifications |Name = RS:X |image = RS-X linedrawing.svg |class_symbol = |class_image = RS-X insigna.png |class_imagealt = Class Symbol |class_imagesize = |type = Sailboard |design = One Design
Neil Pryde |crew = 1 |loa = {{convert|2.86|m|abbr=on}} |beam = {{convert|.93|m|abbr=on}} |mainsail = male: {{convert|9.5|m2|abbr=on}}
female: {{convert|8.5|m2|abbr=on}} |draft = |hull = {{convert|15.5|kg|abbr=on}}
Volume {{convert|231|l|abbr=on}} |ballast = |mainsailandjib= |construction = GRP & Carbon |mastheight = male: {{convert|5.2|m|abbr=on}}
female: {{convert|4.9|m|abbr=on}} |designer = Jean Bouldoires & Robert Stroj |year = 2004 |jib = |spinnaker = |d-pn = |rya-pn = |phrf = |updated = 20-APR-2010 |olympic = current }} [[image:RS X - the olympic board.JPG|thumb]] [[Image:Neil-Pryde-logo.jpg|100px|thumb]] '''RS:X''' is a [[windsurfing]] class selected by the [[International Sailing Federation|ISAF]]http://www.sailing.org/olympics/history-part-5.php Olympic sailing report [[International Sailing Federation|ISAF]] to replace the [[Mistral One Design Class]] for the [[2008 Summer Olympics]]. The discipline has similarities to [[Formula Windsurfing]] - mainly in that the equipment used was designed to allow windsurfing in low and moderate wind conditions with good performance. RS:X equipment includes a board with a [[daggerboard]], and a sail of a specified size. The board measures 286 cm in length and 93 cm in width. Unlike formula boards, it is quite heavy at 15.5 kg, which is almost twice that of regular competition formula boards, but is very similar to the weight of raceboards such as the previous Olympic board, [[Mistral One Design Class]]. The Mistral board has a weight of 17 kg ready to sail, while the RS:X board weighs more than 19 kg. The RS:X seems to be a compromise between traditional raceboards which work well in {{convert|3|to|18|m/s|kn|order=flip|abbr=on|round=5}}, and Formula boards which go fast in {{convert|12|to|30|kn|m/s|abbr=on|round=5}}, and has shown itself to be competitive with past raceboards in the medium wind range. The shape and design of the RS:X sail is based on that of the [[Neil Pryde]] windsurfing sail V8. ==Events== ===Olympics=== ====Men==== {{Olympic medallists in Men's RS:X}} ====Women==== {{Olympic medallists in Women's RS:X}} ===World Championships=== ====RS:X World Championships==== {{main|RS:X World Championships}} =====Men===== {{RS:X Men's World Championship medallists}} =====Women===== {{RS:X Women's World Championship medallists}} ===Youth=== The RS:X Class hold Youth World Championships the age limit used is typically for sailors under 21 ====Youth Male==== {{RS:X Male Youth World Championship medallists}} ====Youth Female==== {{RS:X Female Youth World Championship medallists}} ====Youth Sailing World Championships==== {{main|Youth Sailing World Championships}} The RS:X has been used as equipment in the [[Youth Sailing World Championships]] which is for sailors under 19. =====Boys===== {{RS:X Boys Youth Sailing World Championships medallists}} =====Girls===== {{RS:X Girls Youth Sailing World Championships medallists}} == See also == * [[Neil Pryde]] == References == {{Reflist}} ==External links== {{commonscat|RS:X}} * [http://www.neilpryde.com/ Neil Pryde official website] * [http://www.rsxclass.com/ RS:X Official Site] * [http://www.sailing.org/classesandequipment/RSX.php ISAF RS:X Microsite] {{Classes of World Sailing}} {{Olympic class sailboats}} [[Category:Classes of World Sailing]] [[Category:Windsurfing boards]] [[Category:Olympic sailing classes]]
